description.narrative: A joint UN initiative - UNDP, UN Women and UNFPA. Focus on three main areas: 1) Women's political and economic empowerment 2) Domestic Violence 3) Sexual and reproductive health and rights each component works att policy, institutional and grassroots level.

En gemensam FN-insats, bestående av UNDP, UNFPA och UN Women, inriktat på tre huvudområden: 1) Kvinnors Politiska och ekonomiska deltagande; 2) Våld i hemmet; 3) Sexuell och reproduktiv hälsa och rättigheter. Varje komponent arbetar på tre nivåer: policy, institution och gräsrotsnivå.

sector.narrative: Women’s rights organisations and movements, and government institutions

Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation

Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: The UN Joint Programme to Enhance Gender Equality in Georgia has achieved substantial results in response to the planned outcomes of the program. The highlights of the Joint Program achievements are: • Inclusion of the gender related National Action Plans in the Government’s Human Rights Strategy and Action Plan. • Adoption of the Domestic Violence National Action Plan 2013-2015. • Adoption of the Gender Equality National Action Plan 2014-2016. • Adoption of the National Youth Policy and Action Plan integrating gender equality and Youth sexual and reproductive health and rights • Securing of political will to ratify the Council of Europe Convention on combating and prevention of violence against women and domestic violence (Istanbul Convention) and initiating relevant amendments to the Georgian legislation for adoption by the Parliament. • Adoption of the Ministry of Finance Manual for Program Budgeting, incorporating gender indicators. • Over 1,300 rural women improved capacity and knowledge and actively engaged in solving local problems through program’s vocational education and training, community mobilization and women farmers association activities. • Locally elected women better equipped with skills to successfully advocate for issues through Women Councilors Forum and its task force. • Taking over of funding of the two domestic violence (DV) shelters (Kutaisi and Tsnori) by the Government of Georgia. • The government funding for services for victims of domestic violence thus increased with 159% during the programme period, from 210 000 GEL 2012 to 509 000 GEL in 2015. • Increased awareness and disclosure of DV. • Notable increase of the use of restrictive order with 203% from 361 in 2012 to 2 598 in 2015. • Increased involvement of men and boys in initiatives aimed at eradicating violence against women and girls – men setting up a movement CHVEN (WE) against violence and for gender equality; successfully demonstrating the need to involve men in the gender equality debate in Georgia. • Generating quality knowledge resources for informed decision-making and advocacy with policy and decision-makers using hard evidence on gender-biased sex selection, men and gender relations. • Bringing the importance of the healthy lifestyle education in secondary schools on the forefront of the Ministry of Education and Science agenda through evidence-based advocacy and technical advice. • Promoting youth to be actively engaged in shaping social development, challenging harmful norms and values, advocating to influence policies that affect their lives through participatory youth forums and innovative youth festivals. • Increased scope and focus on public awareness campaigns, including gender stereotypes, women’s political and economic rights, gender-based violence, domestic violence, reproductive health and rights, prevention of GBSS, male involvement, HIV/AIDS, etc.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
